required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: PKPD of Anthocyanins After Oral Cherry Juice Concentrate in Gout Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to establish the pharmacokinetic parameters of cherry juice concentrate and identify its potential to alter inflammatory markers in gout patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Maximal change in hs-CRP from baseline through study completion (during the 12 hours after a dose)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion (during the 12 hours after a dose)
secondary_outcome.description: The area under the plasma anthocyanin concentration-time curve

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion (during the 12 hours after a dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Fold change in mRNA expression of Nrf2

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion (during the 12 hours after a dose)
Through study completion (during the 12 hours after a dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to achieve peak plasma anthocyanin concentration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion (during the 12 hours after a dose)

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive a single oral dose of 60 mL tart cherry concentrate. After a 2 week wash-out subjects will cross over into the 120 mL dose group.
Subjects will receive a single oral dose of 120 mL tart cherry concentrate. After a 2 week wash-out subjects will cross over into the 60 mL dose group.

intervention.description: Subjects will receive a single 60 mL oral dose of tart cherry extract.
Subjects will receive a single 120 mL oral dose of tart cherry extract.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of gout
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergy to cherries or cherry products
- Any history of malignancy
- History of any pancreatic or biliary tract disease
- Significant Anemia
- History of significant renal (sCr > 1.5 mg/dL)
- Hepatic disease (liver enzymes 3 times upper limit of normal)
- Any active gastrointestinal condition
- History of large bowel resection for any reason
- Use of cherry juice concentrate or consumption of cherries within 14 days
- Personal or inherited bleeding disorders or currently on anticoagulation
- Women of childbearing age not on oral contraceptives
- Women who are pregnant or nursing

overall_official.affiliation: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Naomi Schlesinger, MD, Professor of Medicine
